He talks about what he needs to do and he goes out and gets it done. Zahi Hawass , nothing was stolen from the Egyptian Museum and the 70 damaged pieces can all be repaired. But Dreyfus wonders about the mummies. "You can't repair a mummy," she says. If you have a body that's no longer intact, how are you going to perform any kind of examination of it? It's now contaminated. after Mohamad Ali Basha and Pharoah Ramesis Barack Obama " 19:17 Vodafone have defended their decision to suspend their mobile phone services in Egypt after the country's government demanded it- a spokesman for the country told Reuters: We would like to make it clear that the authorities in Egypt have the technical capability to close our network, and if they had done so it would have taken much longer to restore services to our customers. "It has been clear to us that there were no legal or practical options open to Vodafone or any of the mobile operators in Egypt but to comply with the demands of the authorities. 19:10 More on the heartbreaking looting in the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities: Zahi Hawass , the Vice Ehud Barak of Culture, has thanked protesters for keeping the museum safe, but confirms two mummies have been

NBA's Most Valuable Player in 2001, agreed to a$ 4 million, two-year deal with Besiktas after no NBA team offered him a contract. Gary Moore said Allen Iverson last played Saturday. This is the most pain he's ever felt from any injury he's had, Gary Moore said. "He's been in tremendous agony." Allen Iverson spent 10 seasons in Philadelphia before bouncing through Denver and Detroit, ending up in Memphis last season.
